intro: Origanum virescens, commonly known as green oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and small white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage is often used in cooking and herbal remedies due to its pungent, slightly minty flavor. Origanum virescens is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
